unnormalised: Ayurveda is fascinating, isn't it? My grandma, Amma, swears by it. She gets panchakarma done every year near Kottayam. Always says it's better than any fancy Rs. 5000 cream. She even treats her joint pain with special herbal oils. This Onam, she was up and about helping make the payasam! I'm thinking of trying abhyanga. Any recommendations for good centers in Bangalore, maybe within 10 km of Indiranagar?
normalised: Ayurveda is fascinating, isn't it? My grandma, Amma, swears by it. She gets panchakarma done every year near Kottayam. Always says it's better than any fancy rupee five thousand cream. She even treats her joint pain with special herbal oils. This Onam, she was up and about helping make the payasam! I'm thinking of trying abhyanga.
